chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis John Boese was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Payment of costs + DNA surcharge = $518.00 - payment to be taken from any bond on deposit, after being applied to fees in 22CF75, and any remaining balance to be worked out with agent.

No firearms.
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.

No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today, without a valid prescription.
No THC, in any form.
No operating a motor vehicle without a valid license.
No entrance into any bars, taverns, or businesses whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
No contact with known drug users or sellers, except in a treatment setting, and only with prior agent approval.
Must take any medications, as prescribed, for mental health or substance abuse.
May only take vivitrol - no suboxone or methadone.

Mental health evaluation and follow through.
Completion of all assessments, counseling, and follow through as recommended by agent.
Attendance at VIP on 11-03-2022 at 6pm.
DNA sample due 10-14-2022.

timeConds.notes:
with good time and huber release
Consecutive to: to the jail sentence in 22CF75 and any other sentence
